author: hotspringfinder
title: Flutter SDK
description: Flutter is the fastest growing mobile app developer community but currently there's no Flutter library support in the Cardano ecosystem.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem is clear and so is the proposed solution. The impact of the project is to add smart contract features, APIs, data structures, tutorials, and community support to the open source Flutter SDK. .. Having a simple and effective tool to acquire the required talent will be a distinct advantage for Cardano, will drive sustained growth, and is easily scalable. interest in the Flutter SDK will eventually go to where they can find work, so I strongly agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposed team is very experienced in many works, and is in progress. Have a growth mindset and commitment to a supportive and unified community. Since many of these entities are already well versed in experiential learning and are globally available, it is likely that this team will be able to navigate the solution design and integration process, control the Look and assemble a comprehensive living blueprint , which will be a gift to organizations in the future and an important achievement to bring about more organizations . The process is thorough, and the buds are very detailed for the allocation of the requested funds.
f6_assessments.q2: Previous projects from this group have maintained high standards of accountability to the community, and have in fact demonstrated themselves to high standards. This is meta audit thinking, where they are providing great community success audit tools. To that end, Gitbooks is public, and they've clearly stated their intentions for what they'll be looking to track. It's easy for interested users to monitor and even suggest changes in place. The listed KPIs provide organic checkpoints (Add Threshold, Page View Threshold) and incremental measures that will keep the project on track.

f6_assessments.q0: Basically, the core idea is great, matching the key metrics of Challenge is to develop the project in an open-source framework and share their efforts and knowledge back to the community and the Cardano ecosystem. The main aim of the project is to add smart contract features, APIs, data structures, tutorials, and community support to open-source Flutter SDK. The author provided us with an in-depth explanation of the technical proposal's solution, analyzed the reasons why their project was needed and the positive effects of the project on the community and Cardano ecosystem. Risks and solutions have also been fully mentioned.
f6_assessments.q1: Although the project completion timeline has been provided, it would be better if the proposer could present in more detail the main tasks/main activities to be implemented and the objectives/parts of the project to be completed at each stage of the project's development, as I see they have listed many of their intentions in the Summarize your solution to the problem section. Furthermore, a blueprint will make it easier for the community to track the progress of the project. In the budget section, the plus point is they have shown the main categories and the number of hours worked in each category, however, I have not seen the cost breakdown for each category, and this section looks like a roadmap of project development rather than the budget allocation plan. Regarding personnel, the proposer describes to us some information about the key member of the project, his job, and work experience, it can be seen that this person has a deep understanding of the field of the project they're working on, actively participating in the Cardano community, however, it's difficult to validate what the proposer describes so I'd encourage them to attach a Linkedin profile or something can reinforce their words.
f6_assessments.q2: The plus point in this section is that they have provided us with tools/environments so that those interested in the project can track the progress of the project development (GitHub), and they also provide a specific KPI to measure the success of the project is Likes on https://pub.dev/packages/cardano_wallet_sdk exceeding 40. However, I think with a long-term project like theirs, this KPI is not enough to be able to track the level of project success. So I encourage them to calculate one more and another KPI for their long-term plan. In general, the core purpose of the project can solve the problems that the challenge poses, their expertise is also reflected in the technical analysis of the project, I believe they can successfully execute this project. There are only a few minor shortcomings as I mentioned.

f6_assessments.q0:
This project is the continuation of two successfully funded proposals (Fund 5 and 7). Flutter is a powerful development framework (backed by Google) as it allows one to write a single application for all platforms (iOS, Android, Web, and also desktops: OSX, Windows and GNU/Linux!). Having an open source flutter Software Development Kit for cardano will be a huge competitive advantage. As a developper, when you choose a platform to develop on, the existence of SDKs and libraries have a lot of weight in your choice, so if one want to develop a universal application leveraging the power of blockchain then Cardano will be in a better position thanks to the existence of this Flutter SDK. Instead of having specialized developper for each platform you can have a single team focusing on what makes your software uniq instead of managing every quirk of every operating system all of this while keeping your maintenance cost very low (no need to recode at each major OS update: you just update your flutter dependency and recompile your app and voilà!).
The 9 minutes video provided within the proposal gives a very good overview of the current status and potential of the project.
This SDKs literally will make cardano developpement available for hundreds of millions of devices on the planet.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer has already proven his experience in past funds on the same project and is now also part of the Plutus Pioneer 3rd Cohort course. SDKs need to be maintained and to evolve alongside the systems they support. The proposer lowered his budget to ensure funding and plans to request similar amounts in future funds to continue his work on the SDK.
For perspective it would have been nice to add a hint to the effective pay/hour provided by previous funds given the total time actually spent on the project, this could help the proposer justify his current and future funding costs.
The requested amount of $15k is quite low and this is a one man project so there is no real risk of running out of funds to continue the work (as he said in the comment: this did not prevent him from working on the project after exhausting his initial time estimation).
The risks have been considered (mainly wrong time estimation) but nothing he aims at doing is impossible or should contain unmanageable engineering issues.
There is only one thing that troubles me in this project: the mentioning of having to reimplement some cryptography in Dart but the lack of auditing. This is truly mandatory for any cryptographic algorithm implementation, as the SDK is still a work in progress that can be dealt with later but it should be mentioned and maybe addressed into a specific proposal. This would reinforce trust and support for the whole project.
f6_assessments.q2:
The provided KPIs are GitHub commits and likes on pub.dev from other devs using the package. It can seem minimal but it's really the basic for any open source project and library and is sufficient at this stage but more could be added later once the SDK matures, such as:
- Number of unit tests.
- Number of independent apps using the package.
- Number of important projects using the package.
- Number of external contributions (pull request, issue reporting, etc...), these metrics also prove usage and usefulness.

The library being in an alpha stage, it's too soon to have production software rely on it but we can see the progress by looking at the changelog on the provided pub.dev link: https://pub.dev/packages/cardano_wallet_sdk/changelog

On GitHub we can see that the SDK is getting some traction: some issues are reported and being addressed, people have forked the repository and 20 people have added the repo to their favorites to follow its evolution. All of these are good indicators of progress and interest.

A lot remains to be done but given the low budget and very high impact it's a risk well worth taking given the proven commitment of the proposer and the indubitable impact for Cardano’s dev ecosystem..

f6_assessments.q0: Flutter is Google promoted technology that is likely to revolutionize mobile development with Cardano flutter SDK a is a proof of concept which has been developed by the proposer after fund five allotments. The current proposal is for improving the package.  The main advantages quoted by the proposer are compelling and it is believed that the package will become mature and will become very useful if these upgrades are done.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal has already delivered a well-documented working prototype in the past. The current proposal is for further refinement and improvement.  Therefore it can be easily said that the proposer who had delivered in the past will be able to complete the project this time also.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal is for 15000 USD funding for more than 200 hours of work including building 250 hours of smart contracts. This is a highly reasonable proposal. Moreover, the complete project is open-source hence the work its quality and its output are in the open domain hence highly auditable.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposer has built a flutter sdk in the Dart progreamming language which is the same language powering Flutter. So this is truly a first class SDK for flutter unlike many others. I really like this proposal as a developer, because it shows what a solid effort by a single person can do for the environment. This proposal sure has an impact on all flutter developers that want to get in the cardano ecospace and after I had a look through the sdk 'kicking the tyre' as mentioned in the docs I found the SDK really well done and intuitive to use.
This project is in the right category being placed in the open source developer ecosystem, since it gives back to the community in the form of an SDK which is professionally made to say the least. It shows a clear problem being solved by no relying or Rust code to do several tasks not implemented in most SDKs.
There are metrics for this proposal upping the numbers of likes in pub.dev which is reasonable, although the goal standing at 20 seems a bit like setting the bar low. This proposal is nonetheless not missing anything and compared to other projects, this has a signifficant advantage of already beeing made and working. The proposer has overcommited on the initial work and has put in more hours than originally planned and now he needs some funding to break even and let me assure you as a dev myself that this guy deserves it, and if we as a comunity can keep him around we will reap the benefits later on. Overall a great job on the SDK, and good luck to the author!
f6_assessments.q1:
There's just one guy doing all the work of the whole sdk, which is really impressive. I found his linked in and I am really impressed of what he's able to do in such a small amount of time. Let me tell you it's impressive. Having seen already 40+ proposals this is one of the better ones because of one simple reason: the work has already been done, and the man is just asking for funding.
I do appreciate the learning curve he's got with understanding the small funding is more likely to be funded and as each fund has more and more money to give, the projects and their requested funds will be able to grow with it. He has the right idea now to keep the funding requested low, but I urge him to keep around until we're able to afford him.
The budget is outlined clearly and the work that needs doing is estimated percicely and the best part is, the work is already done and asking just for retroactive funding, which is not a precedent by any means and others have done it successfuly already. I don't need to talk about the plans for the implementation as it's already done, I just need to point out as a developer, that the proposer is a realy realy experienced guy that brings a lot to the table.
Overall the challenges he presents not having enough time is the biggest real challenge I see for this project, and I hope this gets funded.
Overall more than feasible proposal.
f6_assessments.q2:
I could just end the review by linking the github repository with all the code inside. I usually say anyone interested will be able to follow up with the project, but I rarely get to say they can try it out right now. There sure is a lot more to follow further down the line.
I like the roadmap and where this SDK is headed and there's a lot more work comming. A clear problem statement, alongside a clear solution and implementation to the problem at hand. Overall an auditable proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: The flutter SDK proposal answers the Open Source Development Ecosystem challenge by providing the Flutter SDK for flutter developers to leverage Cardano Blockchain. Watching his YouTube on his project Wallet SDK project from fund 5, the project is very well documented and explained and in this fund 8, high level smart contract and user define structure and common off-chain client APIs will be duplicated in Dart. The proposal will continue the momentum of his previously funded proposal and this open sourced project will be beneficial to other projects in Catalyst.
f6_assessments.q1: One year from now this project should be completed. His 250 hours of work in smart contract is plausible for one year. The fact that he will add 2 user cases and tool for off-chain code suggest that he cares how well others can understand in what he is doing. Also his effort in making tutorial will easen the steep learning curve for the projects that want to use his open source code. For the next funding round (Hopefully in different proposal topic) It would be useful to add the profile link of the proposer and perhaps shorter timeline to deliver the final output. It is very likely that the project will be completed by the timeline. It is perhaps a good thing in disguise that he has 1 year to deliver the project in detailed with full instruction.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposers has provided GitHub commits and test coverage as KPIs. The project progress tracking and successful delivery can be monitored by the community. The proposer understands the importance to have flutter SDK for Cardano and make it open source for other projects to use. The gap for this challenge has been filled by his solution. The App link feature is a very exciting feature and hope that his project will be successful so that the Cardano Developers or project owners can enjoy the fruitful result of this proposal.

solution: Continue adding smart contract features, APIs, data structures, tutorials and community support to open-source Flutter SDK.
experience:
Fund 5 & Fund 7 Recipient
4 years Flutter/Dart
10 years iOS/Android
25 years Server-side Java
6 years tooling/code generation
Enrolled in Plutus Pioneers 3rd Cohort
